page.title: 07FARMING - MACHINERY
page.content: Eight men plus one student from Easton agricultural college work on the farm. Up to 1950 30 men were employed. Five live on the farm and three in their own accomodation. Mr Alston has a wide range of modern machinery, though he has 2 Allis Chalmers tractors from pre-war days tucked away! Today, however, 80% of farm machinery comes from abroad. The machinery includes two combines and two Massey diggers to clean ditches and to load corn and fertiliser. There is a hedge-trimmer, sprayer, a large American John Deere tractor, a French sugar beet harvester, two British ploughs and a 1941 tractor! A modern lorry is used 7 months of the year taking beet to Bury St Edmunds and grain to Diss, Ipswich and Yarmouth. Feed barley is exported to East Germany and Russia.
